name: phone-fns
description: Small and simple functional phone library

docs.title: breakdown
docs.desc: Takes a provided phone string and breaks it down into an object of codes
examples: breakdown('111-222-3333');// => { areaCode: '111', localCode: '222', lineNumber: '3333', extension: '' }breakdown('5554441111');// => { areaCode: '555', localCode: '444', lineNumber: '1111', extension: '' }breakdown('', '555-444-3333 x 8989');// => { areaCode: '555', localCode: '444', lineNumber: '3333', extension: 8989 }

returns.description: Returns an object of the broken down phone number

params.description: The provided country code for the number
params.name: countryCode

docs.title: format
docs.desc: Allows you to format phone numbers however you desire using N as number placeholders and C as country code placeholders these placeholders are case insensitive

returns.description: Returns a string which is the formatted phone number

params.description: The desired layout of the phone number
params.name: layout

docs.title: isValid
docs.desc: Validates the base number, does not take the country code or extension into consideration for this validation

returns.description: Returns a boolean if the number provided is valid or not

docs.title: uglify
docs.desc: Strips all of the special characters from the given string

returns.description: Returns the newly created phone number string

params.description: The phone number to trim and strip down
params.name: phone
